displayTitle.title: Display title
displayTitle.description: When viewing a menu/page - this is the title that will be displayed on the menu/page

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: When viewing a menu/page - this is the subtitle that will be displayed on the menu/page

pageBody.title: Page body
pageBody.description: If set, this text will be shown instead of the body text when this page is viewed.

_htmlClasses.title: HTML Classes
_htmlClasses.description: If set, this CSS class/es will be applied to the <html> element whenever this is the active page in the course. These are predefined in the theme or added in Project Settings > Custom CSS/Less code.

alt.title: Alt
alt.description: This is the alternative text that is displayed when the image is not visible. This is also used by screen readers.

src.title: Src
src.description: This is the link to the image.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Indicates how long this page or section should take to complete

_lockedBy.title: Locked by
_lockedBy.description: If the course is using a 'custom' Menu Lock Type, this should contain the unique ID of the item(s) which must be completed before this is unlocked

_lockType.title: Menu lock type
_lockType.description: Defines which (if any) locking mechanism will be used. To be used only on submenus.

_classes.title: Page Classes
_classes.description: Used to style or manipulate the look and feel of this Page (or submenu). These are predefined in the theme or added in Project Settings > Custom CSS/Less code.

_isOptional.title: Is this optional?
_isOptional.description: An optional page does not have to be completed, nor do any of the articles, blocks and components contained within it.

_isAvailable.title: Is this available?
_isAvailable.description: Controls whether this page and its contents are available in the course or not.

_isHidden.title: Is this hidden?
_isHidden.description: Hides this page from the course menu. Needs to be supported by the menu you are using in your course.

_isVisible.title: Is this visible?
_isVisible.description: Equivalent to the CSS visibility property. Unless you have custom code that uses this, it is highly unlikely you would want to change this setting at a page level.

_ariaLevel.title: Aria level
_ariaLevel.description: If you need to override the default page ARIA level (as defined in Configuration Settings), set this to any number greater than 0.

_onScreen.title: On-screen classes
_onScreen.description: These settings allow you to attach classes to the page when it is within the browser's viewport; helpful for running CSS-based animations on pages as they scroll into view.

_classes.title: Classes
_classes.description: The CSS class(es) to add to the page element.

_percentInviewVertical.title: Percent in view
_percentInviewVertical.description: Controls what percentage of the page's height needs to be in the viewport in order for the CSS class(es) to be added.
